file_content.text: Any more sage advice? I could climb onto the counter and meditate until they offer me a snack.
If the point of being Sith is being angry, at least that's working.
There you go. Anger is easiest to wield. Now show what you can do with it.
Alright, Guss, it isn't helping. Just do whatever makes you comfortable.
I'm sorry, I know you're trying to help. I'll maybe just wing it this time, I'm kind of used to that.
Nothing's working. When you're bad at being Jedi and Sith, what else is left?
You're an odd one. Trying to fit you into a prescribed mold might be the real problem.
Jedi sometimes waver, but they persevere. You need to as well.
Most Sith don't get the luxury of trying again, so make the most of it.
That was a lot less embarrassing than the first time. I still don't know what I'm doing wrong.
At least your morale seems high. Try it again, like last time.
I'll get it this time, I'm sure.
You're dwelling on pride and fear. Let it go.
You need to grasp for a more powerful emotion and feed on it.
Would it be too much to ask to leave the usual Jedi dogma out of this? I at least left with my dignity the first time.
You have to put aside those feelings of fear and embarrassment. Can't you see that's why you're stuck?
I'm not a droid! I can't flip a switch and stop caring--hey, maybe that's it. I'll just pretend I'm a droid.
Yes, you're too emotional for Jedi teachings. We should take advantage of that.
Ball up my anger into a webbed fist and shake it until I get what I want. I can try.
So, can we safely rule out the intimidation tactics? There was definitely a lack of murderous intent the first time.
If you want cowardice to continue to be your first response to everything, by all means.
It's worked so far. Okay! Fine!
Pushing you hasn't worked in the past, I shouldn't have expected it to be different now. Go at your own pace.
I'm going to give talking another go, at least I can fail with my dignity and person intact.
I know you never took to Jedi training, but it has to be more effective than what you've been doing.
If at first you don't succeed, wear success down with constant badgering. Got it.
Here goes nothing!
I tried, I really did, but she was flirting with me and that never happens. I have a pack of Tarisian ale, a holo address and shame.
Turns out making an attractive Mon Calamari cry is a real wet blanket on the whole "rage" thing.
That went a lot better than the last couple times. We had a lot in common--and those eyes--the mind trick thing came off a little weird though.
It's time to face the music. If music was mostly long sighs and eye rolling.
Third time's the charm, that's what people who aren't me say anyway. You're pretty good luck, I haven't been kicked out once!
Talking is your comfort zone. I think it's helping.
It is sort of a defense mechanism... until I put my foot in my mouth.
Staying optimistic is good, but you still have nothing to show. It's time to think back to your Jedi training.
You have no more opportunities to play nice. Assert yourself before you have to return a failure.
Yeah. You're right. My master didn't send me out here to boost my self-esteem.
Time to shine!
I did it! I really did it! I'm mostly certain--beyond a reasonable doubt.
I put on my most placid, soulless face and was ready to serene my way to mild victory, but my heart wasn't in it.
I had my meanest sabacc face on--the one by the end of the night when I'm broke--but tonight's been pretty good, actually.
When the clerk smiled, I just knew what to do. We got to talking about how good the urchin is, and we both hadn't eaten all night.
So I say, "you should have one," and then she says "you should have one," and hands it to me. So we split it and I got the Tarisian ale.
You've taken your first steps on a new path.
See, you always had it in you.
I guess I have.
Just hope it wasn't a coincidence.
A genuine Force intervention is the only explanation I can believe.
Hah! Can't wait to rub this in that old geezer's face!
I'll practice my Huttball goal zone dance. That'll be the cue.
I can't wait to show my master!
[Cheat] I'm done with this. Take a few credits and buy what you need.
Yeah... you've been more patient with this than I could expect.
This is the place. Dumpier than I remember... I probably shouldn't say that out loud.
I spent years getting the "master your emotions" drummed into my head, I'm not sure a few more times are going to make the difference.
Stick with it, Guss. Getting it right the first time isn't the point.
I was never good at telling the difference between perseverance and futility.
Do what comes naturally.
Embrace them then.
Is that how most Sith get their start? Lectured straight into the dark side?
Having a scrapper like you to back me up is reassuring, but I'm not really sure the whole "rule through fear" is my strong suit.
Quit wilting at the first sign of difficulty.
It's not something you can fake. Just try being yourself.
I don't know that anyone has ever said that to me with any sincerity. I like it.
If you can't use your emotions, they'll only distract you. Find peace.
The owner probably doesn't get a lot of compliments. Maybe I should lead with that and see where it goes?
If that's what feels right, who am I to say otherwise?
An actual Jedi?
A real Sith?
Or is that your sideways way of saying use my intuition?
Okay, Guss, just act natural.
It's as good a plan as any.
I was hoping for a greater vote of confidence.Tacit approval is a step up though.
I think we're distracting you from your true purpose. Focus and discipline are required to master the Force.
I thought that advice would make things easier, but I think it's just distracting you. Keep your mind focused on the task.
Back to Jedi basics....
We've coddled you enough. You're supposed to be learning to bend the will of another.
Playing nice was probably a mistake. You need to get serious, show them who's boss.
That always worked better when I was waving the lightsaber instead of my hands... I'll try.
Think, Lord Struction. Be, Lord Struction.
I'm calm. I'm calm. I'm. Calm. Do Jedi know how dumb they look when this doesn't work!
Do you think being laughed at instead of attacked counts as progress?
I never knew running a dumpy shack could be so complicated. You know there's Hutt-mandated shabbiness zoning?
Before you ask, no, but the gentle letdown is a first.
Come on, there's one more place I can try.
[Cheat] This is ridiculous. Just grab what you need and let's be done with it.
I admit, it does feel pretty ridiculous to fuss over grocery shopping, and I'm well acquainted with ridiculous.
Okay, I think I'm still allowed into this one. I guess you should wait out here. Maybe cross your fingers, duck preemptively.
You're smarter than that old goat. Just buy his stupid Tarisian ale and pocket whatever else you want.
Why? I'm good at lying and stealing. How's that help me get good at anything else?
Fair enough.
May as well get it over with.
Calm yourself, Guss. That fear and doubt won't serve you here.
You sound just like my old master. You know just saying "feel this way" doesn't really help? Breathe... breathe.
Fear. Doubt. Resentment. Don't fight them. Seize them. That raw emotion is a strength you've been taught to leave bound up and useless.
I must be the deadliest untapped weapon in the galaxy then. Guess it couldn't hurt to try once.
Just relax. You're probably just getting performance anxiety.
I suppose I should be more prepared for failure by now.
Forget the errands, go in there and make a friend. It'll be easier to convince the owner if you're well-liked.
A mind trick works most easily if the suggestion is something the being would do anyway.
The old Languss Tuno charm is a force I can handle.
Domination is the key. Make eye contact and focus everything on projecting your will.
Show some spine. If you don't even believe you can change their mind, why should they?
Intimidation, right. I've got the Force, what have I got to be worried about from a clerk!
Here I go!
[Cheat] Just do it, Guss. Your master is only jerking us around.
He... I mean, I guess I see that.
I just like trying. It feels like playing a lottery, the odds of winning are nil, but you can dream.
It'll just be a minute.
Piece of cake, or urchin roll. Used to make these fresh back on Varn, you have not lived until you've had one with coffee.
We'd better get back to my master. You do not want to see the guy without his Tarisian ale.
Remember how we were talking about being calm?
I was doing great. The other guy... he wasn't so calm after the third try.
We'd better go before he finds his blaster. There's another place we can try not too far from here.
Didn't work!
I don't know what happened. I thought we were really bonding over the last Huttball playoff, but Frogdog solidarity stops at free samples.
I think there's another place we can try nearby. Maybe Rotworm fans are more generous?
